Class Player

java.lang.Object
fr.connexe.ui.game.Player
public class Player extends Object

A player in a game session, moving around to maze to reach the end.

This class works by using a state machine to handle all different states the player might be in.

    Creates a new player based off a player profile and its index in the player list.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(PlayerProfile profile, Point startPos, GameMode gameMode, int index)
      Creates a new player based off a player profile and its index in the player list.
      Parameters:
      profile - The profile of the player.
      startPos - The starting position of the player in the maze
      gameMode - The game mode of the game session this player participates in
      index - The index of the player in the players list.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFX

      public void initializeFX(Pane gameOverlay)
      Places JavaFX objects of this player into the game overlay.
      Parameters:
      gameOverlay - The maze overlay to add the player to.

    • update

      public void update(GraphMaze maze, double deltaTime, long lastTimestamp, @Nullable @Nullable ControllerHub controllerHub)
      Runs frame update logic for this player. Updates the current state and runs any animation (moving, stunned and all that),
      Parameters:
      maze - The maze to use for collision checking.
      deltaTime - The time since the last frame, in seconds.
      lastTimestamp - The last timestamp in nanoseconds.
      controllerHub - The controller hub to use for haptic feedback.

    • render

      public void render(Function<Vector2,Vector2> toFXCoordinates, double cellHeight, double cellWidth)
      Updates the JavaFX avatar of this player. Must be called every frame after updating all entities.
      Parameters:
      toFXCoordinates - The function to convert world coordinates to JavaFX coordinates.
      cellHeight - The height of the maze cell in JavaFX coordinates.
      cellWidth - The width of the maze cell in JavaFX coordinates.

    • acceptMoveInput

      public void acceptMoveInput(GraphMaze maze, double deltaTime, int offsetX, int offsetY)

      Accepts a move input from the player's controller or keyboard.

      Only accepts inputs when the player is idle.

      Fails when the offsets are invalid (not 1 or -1).

      Parameters:
      maze - the maze the player plays in
      deltaTime - the delta time of this frame
      offsetX - the offset in the X axis (-1 or 1)
      offsetY - the offset in the Y axis (-1 or 1)

    • getProfile

      public PlayerProfile getProfile()
      Returns the player profile used to create this player.
      Returns:
      The player profile used to create this player.

    • getIndex

      public int getIndex()
      Returns the index of this player in the player list.

    • isIdle

      public boolean isIdle()
      Returns true when this player is in the "idle" state.
      Returns:
      True if this player is in the "idle" state.

    • hasReachedEnd

      public boolean hasReachedEnd()
      Returns true when this player has reached the end of the maze.
      Returns:
      True if this player has reached the end of the maze.

    • getReachedEndAt

      public long getReachedEndAt()
      Returns the Epoch timestamp at which the user reached the end of the maze. Returns -1 if they didn't reach the end yet.
      Returns:
      The Epoch timestamp at which the user reached the end of the maze, or -1 if they didn't reach it yet.

    • getWorldPosition

      public Vector2 getWorldPosition()
      Get the world position of this player (localPos + offset), in the maze coordinate space.
      Returns:
      The world position of this player.

    • getInputSource

      public PlayerInputSource getInputSource()
      Returns the input source of this player: the input device (keyboard/controller) the player uses to move.
      Returns:
      The input source of this player.

    • getMovesDone

      public int getMovesDone()
      Returns the total number of successful moves done since the beginning of the game.
      Returns:
      The total number of moves
